results.title: [Visit to Healesville Sanctuary by Princess Alexandra]
results.brief_description: Silent film recording the visit of Princess Alexandra to Healesville Sanctuary, Victoria. Includes many shots of the birds and animals at the Sanctuary.

results.title: Bush and beach around Melbourne
results.brief_description:
This film is made up of various scenes of coastal and bush areas in and around Victoria: life saving display at St. Kilda; some views around the beaches to Portsea; bathers and motor boating across the bay to Queenscliff; into the nearest ranges, fields of daffodils around Healesville, Marysville and Warburton districts; gun-dogs in action; fly-fishing; the Dandenong ranges.
No credits available.

results.title: Seaside holiday
results.brief_description: A motoring holiday along some of Victoria’s most beautiful coast roads, introducing some of the scenic beauties to be found along the highways which skirt the ocean beaches of this State.

results.title: Apollo 10: around the moon
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The film shows various footage of Apollo 10’s travel around the moon including: the Command module filmed from the Lunar module; the far side of the moon; Command module over landing site No. 2; view from Lunar module sixty miles up; inside the Lunar module; Lunar module descent and much more.

results.title: The Blue streak rocket
results.creator_credit: George Grafton Green and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Blue Streak Rocket is the first stage in the development of a rocket which will help boost a one ton satellite, of the European Launcher Development Organisation, into orbit three hundred miles high. Shows the static test in England and the launching at Woomera.

results.title: Children of the Musgraves (A)
results.creator_credit: Edmee Campbell-Dobbie, J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Filmed at Ernabella Mission Station in the Musgrave Ranges, 1000 miles north of Adelaide. Shows the life of Aborigines, their schooling and play, and their assimilation to white Australian ways. They are also given time each day to follow their own cultural traditions of hunting and cooking. Narrated by J.J. Hume.

results.brief_description: Gymnastic youngsters bound through a regime of physical health and fitness. An instructional film promoting an ideal of rigorous physical culture demonstrating a number of acrobatic manouvers.

results.title: Morning paper
results.creator_credit: Darrel Catling, Donald Carter, H. Bruce Woolfe and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The story of a newspaper during wartime. Shows how the news is gathered and prepared for the press in spite of the threat of bombs. Describes the composition and checking of the pages, the creation of curved steroes to fit the rotary presses and various other tasks that must be completed before the paper can be put to bed.

results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Women's Health Resources Foundation, Womens Film Fund, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Susan Lambert and Robyn Dryen
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.
